Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
The Multi-Lingual Minor allows students who have extensive non-academic experience with a language that is not taught on our campus to pursue a minor in that language.

 

Requirements:

 

Test out of 101, 102, and 201 (4 credits each) through the FLATS test in one of the following languages: 

 

Afrikaans, Albanian, Arabic, Armenian, Aymara, Bulgarian, Cakchiquel, Cambodian, Cantonese, Cebuano, Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dutch, Estonian, Farsi-Persian, Fijian, Finnish, Greek (modern), Guarani, Haitian Creole, Hmong, Hungarian, Icelandic, Ilonggo/Hiligaynon, Indonesian, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Latvian, Lithuanian, Malagasy, Maori-New Zealand, Mongolian, Navajo, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese, Quechua, Rarotongan, Romanian, Samoan, Serbian, Swedish, Tagalog, Tahitian, Thai, Tongan, Ukrainian, Vietnamese, Welsh

 

Also take:  LANG 321, LANG 400, and LANG 410 (3 credits each)

 

Total Minor Credits = 21
